verses.verse: And Jacob<WH3290> went<WH1980> on his way<WH1870>, and the angels<WH4397> of God<WH430> met him<WH6293>.
And when Jacob<WH3290> saw them<WH7200>, he said<WH559>, This is God<WH430>'s host<WH4264>: and he called<WH7121> the name<WH8034> of that place<WH4725> Mahanaim<WH4266>.
And Jacob<WH3290> sent<WH7971> messengers<WH4397> before him<WH6440> to Esau<WH6215> his brother<WH251> unto the land<WH776> of Seir<WH8165>, the country<WH7704> of Edom<WH123>.

And he commanded<WH6680> them<WH559>, saying, Thus shall you speak<WH559> unto my lord<WH113> Esau<WH6215>; your servant<WH5650> Jacob<WH3290> says<WH559> thus<WH1481>, I have stayed with Laban<WH3837>, and stayed there until now<WH309>:

And I have oxen<WH7794>, and donkeys<WH2543>, flocks<WH6629>, and menservants<WH5650>, and womenservants<WH8198>: and I have sent<WH7971> to tell<WH5046> my lord<WH113>, that I may find<WH4672> grace<WH2580> in your sight<WH5869>.

And the messengers<WH4397> returned<WH7725> to Jacob<WH3290>, saying<WH559>, We came<WH935> to your brother<WH251> Esau<WH6215>, and also he comes<WH1980> to meet you<WH7125>, and four hundred<WH3967> men with him<WH376>.

Then Jacob<WH3290> was greatly<WH3966> afraid<WH3372> and distressed<WH3334>: and he divided<WH2673> the people<WH5971> that was with him<WH6629>, and the flocks, and herds<WH1241>, and the camels<WH1581>, into two<WH8147> bands<WH4264>;
And said<WH559>, If Esau<WH6215> come<WH935> to the one<WH259> company<WH4264>, and strikes it<WH5221>, then the other company<WH4264> which is left<WH7604> shall escape<WH6413>.

And Jacob<WH3290> said<WH559>, O God<WH430> of my father<WH1> Abraham<WH85>, and God<WH430> of my father<WH1> Isaac<WH3327>, the Lord<WH3068> which said<WH559> unto me<WH7725>, Return unto your country<WH776>, and to your relatives<WH4138>, and I will deal well with you<WH3190>

I am not worthy of the least<WH6994> of all the mercies<WH2617>, and of all the truth<WH571>, which you have shown<WH6213> unto your servant<WH5650>; for with my staff<WH4731> I passed over<WH5674> this Jordan<WH3383>; and now I am become two<WH8147> bands<WH4264>.

Deliver me<WH5337>, I pray you from the hand<WH3027> of my brother<WH251>, from the hand<WH3027> of Esau<WH6215>: for I fear<WH3373> him<WH935>, lest he will come and strike me<WH5221>, and the mother<WH517> with<WH5921> the sons<WH1121>.
And you said<WH559>, I will surely<WH3190> do you good<WH3190>, and make<WH7760> your seed<WH2233> as the sand<WH2344> of the sea<WH3220>, which cannot be numbered<WH5608> for multitude<WH7230>.
And he lodged<WH3885> there that same night<WH3915>; and took<WH3947> of that which came<WH935> to his hand<WH3027> a present<WH4503> for Esau<WH6215> his brother<WH251>;
Two hundred<WH3967> she goats<WH5795>, and twenty<WH6242> he goats<WH8495>, two hundred<WH3967> ewes<WH7353>, and twenty<WH6242> rams<WH352>,
Thirty<WH7970> milk<WH3243> camels<WH1581> with their colts<WH1121>, forty<WH705> cows<WH6510>, and ten<WH6235> bulls<WH6499>, twenty<WH6242> she donkeys<WH860>, and ten<WH6235> foals<WH5895>.

And he delivered<WH5414> them into the hand<WH3027> of his servants<WH5650>, every herd<WH5739> by themselves<WH559>; and said unto his servants<WH5650>, Pass over<WH5674> before me<WH6440>, and put<WH7760> a space<WH7305> between<WH996> herd<WH5739> and<WH996> herd<WH5739>.

And he commanded<WH6680> the foremost<WH7223>, saying<WH559>, When Esau<WH6215> my brother<WH251> meets you<WH6298>, and asketh you<WH7592>, saying<WH559>, Whose are you<WH3212>, and where go you<WH6440>, and whose are these before you?
Then you shall say<WH559>, They be your servant<WH5650> Jacob<WH3290>'s; it is a present<WH4503> sent<WH7971> unto my lord<WH113> Esau<WH6215>: and<WH310>, behold, also he is behind us.

And so<WH1571> commanded he<WH6680> the second<WH8145>, and the third<WH7992>, and all that followed<WH1980> the herds<WH5739>, saying<WH559>, On this manner<WH1697> shall you speak<WH1696> unto Esau<WH6215>, when you find him<WH4672>.

And say you<WH559> moreover<WH1571>, Behold<WH5650>, your servant Jacob<WH3290> is behind us<WH310>. For he said<WH559>, I will appease<WH3722> him<WH6440> with the present<WH4503> that goeth<WH1980> before me<WH6440>, and afterward<WH310> I will see<WH7200> his face<WH6440>; what if he will accept<WH5375> of me<WH6440>.
So went<WH5674> the present<WH4503> over<WH5674> before him<WH6440>: and himself lodged<WH3885> that night<WH3915> in the company<WH4264>.

And he rose up<WH6965> that night<WH3915>, and took<WH3947> his two<WH8147> wives<WH802>, and his two<WH8147> womenservants<WH8198>, and his eleven<WH6240> sons<WH3206>, and passed over<WH5674> the ford<WH4569> Jabbok<WH2999>.
And he took them<WH3947>, and sent them over<WH5674> the brook<WH5158>, and sent over that he had<WH5674>.
And Jacob<WH3290> was left<WH3498> alone<WH79>; and there wrestled a man<WH376> with him until the breaking<WH5927> of the day<WH7837>.

And when he saw<WH7200> that he prevailed<WH3201> not against him<WH5060>, he touched the hollow of his thigh<WH3409>; and the hollow<WH3709> of Jacob<WH3290>'s thigh<WH3409> was out of joint<WH3363>, as he wrestled with him<WH79>.
And he said<WH559>, Let me go<WH7971>, for the day<WH7837> breaks<WH5927>. And he said<WH559>, I will not let you go<WH7971>, except<WH518> you bless me<WH1288>.
And he said<WH559> unto him<WH8034>, What is your name? And he said<WH559>, Jacob<WH3290>.

And he said<WH559>, your name<WH8034> shall be called<WH559> no more Jacob<WH3290>, but Israel<WH3478>: for as a prince have you power<WH8280> with God<WH430> and with men<WH582>, and have prevailed<WH3201>.

And Jacob<WH3290> asked<WH7592> him<WH559>, and said, Tell<WH5046> me<WH8034>, I pray you your name. And he said<WH559>, Why is it<WH2088> that you do ask<WH7592> after my name<WH8034>? And he blessed him there<WH1288>.
And Jacob<WH3290> called<WH7121> the name<WH8034> of the place<WH4725> Peniel<WH6439>: for I have seen<WH7200> God<WH430> face<WH6440> to face<WH6440>, and my life<WH5315> is preserved<WH5337>.
And as he passed over<WH5674> Penuel<WH6439> the sun<WH8121> rose<WH2224> upon him<WH6760>, and he limped upon his thigh<WH3409>.

Therefore the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> eat<WH398> not of the sinew<WH1517> which shrank<WH5384>, which is upon the hollow<WH3709> of the thigh<WH3409>, unto this day<WH3117>: because he touched<WH5060> the hollow<WH3709> of Jacob<WH3290>'s thigh<WH3409> in the sinew<WH1517> that shrank<WH5384>.
